class.name: RayCast2D
class.brief_description: Query the closest object intersecting a ray.
class.description: A RayCast represents a line from its origin to its destination position, [code]cast_to[/code]. It is used to query the 2D space in order to find the closest object along the path of the ray. RayCast2D can ignore some objects by adding them to the exception list via [code]add_exception[/code], by setting proper filtering with collision layers, or by filtering object types with type masks. Only enabled raycasts will be able to query the space and report collisions. RayCast2D calculates intersection every fixed frame (see [Node]), and the result is cached so it can be used later until the next frame. If multiple queries are required between fixed frames (or during the same frame) use [method force_raycast_update] after adjusting the raycast.

method.name: add_exception
method.description: Adds a collision exception so the ray does not report collisions with the specified node.

method.name: add_exception_rid
method.description: Adds a collision exception so the ray does not report collisions with the specified [RID].

method.name: clear_exceptions
method.description: Removes all collision exceptions for this ray.

method.name: force_raycast_update
method.description: Updates the collision information for the ray. Use this method to update the collision information immediately instead of waiting for the next [code]_fixed_process[/code] call, for example if the ray or its parent has changed state. Note: [code]enabled == true[/code] is not required for this to work.

method.name: get_cast_to
method.description: Return the destination point of this ray object.

method.name: get_collider
get_collider_shape
get_collision_layer
method.description: Returns the collision layer for this ray.

method.name: get_collision_normal
method.description: Returns the normal of the intersecting object's shape at the collision point.

method.name: get_collision_point
method.description: Returns the collision point at which the ray intersects the closest object. Note: this point is in the [b]global[/b] coordinate system.

method.name: get_exclude_parent_body
method.description: Returns whether this ray should hit your parent node, if it's a body.

method.name: get_type_mask
method.description: Returns the type mask (types of objects to detect) for this ray. The value is a sum (bitwise OR'd) of constants available for [Physics2DDirectSpaceState].

method.name: is_colliding
method.description: Return whether the closest object the ray is pointing to is colliding with the vector (considering the vector length).

method.name: is_enabled
method.description: Returns whether this raycast is enabled or not.

method.name: remove_exception
method.description: Removes a collision exception so the ray does report collisions with the specified node.

method.name: remove_exception_rid
method.description: Removes a collision exception so the ray does report collisions with the specified [RID].

method.name: set_cast_to
method.description: Sets the ray destination point, so that the ray will test from the ray's origin to [code]local_point[/code]

method.name: set_collision_layer
method.description: Set the mask to filter objects. Only objects with at least the same mask element set will be detected.

method.name: set_enabled
method.description: Enables the RayCast2D. Only enabled raycasts will be able to query the space and report collisions.

method.name: set_exclude_parent_body
method.description: Toggle whether this ray should hit your parent node, if it's a body.

method.name: set_type_mask
method.description: Set the types of objects to detect. For [code]mask[/code] use a logic sum (OR operation) of constants defined in [Physics2DDirectSpaceState], eg. [code]Physics2DDirectSpaceState.TYPE_MASK_STATIC_BODY | Physics2DDirectSpaceState.TYPE_MASK_KINEMATIC_BODY[/code] to detect only those two types.

members.member: The ray's destination point, relative to the RayCast's [code]position[/code].
The RayCast2D's collison layer(s). Only bodies in the same collision layer(s) will be detected.
If [code]true[/code], collisions will be reported. Default value: [code]false[/code].
If [code]true[/code], the parent node will be excluded from collision detection. Default value: [code]true[/code].

Object types to detect using a logical sum (OR operation) of type constants defined in [Physics2DDirectSpaceState]. Example: [codeblock] RayCast.type_mask = Physics2DDirectSpaceState.TYPE_MASK_STATIC_BODY | Physics2DDirectSpaceState.TYPE_MASK_KINEMATIC_BODY [/codeblock]
